  • Constructor Details

    • Binary

      public Binary​(rohde_schwarz.rs_instrument.Instrument io)

  • Method Details

    • getFloatNumbersFormat

      public InstrBinaryFloatNumbersFormat getFloatNumbersFormat()
      Returns the coding of floating-point numbers in binary data. Swapped means the endianness of the instrument is different from endianness of the Control PC.

    • setFloatNumbersFormat

      public void setFloatNumbersFormat​(InstrBinaryFloatNumbersFormat value)
      Sets the coding of floating-point numbers in binary data. Swapped means the endianness of the instrument is different from endianness of the Control PC.

    • getIntegerNumbersFormat

      public InstrBinaryIntegerNumbersFormat getIntegerNumbersFormat()
      Returns the coding of integer numbers in binary data Swapped means the endianness of the instrument is different from endianness of the Control PC.

    • setIntegerNumbersFormat

      public void setIntegerNumbersFormat​(InstrBinaryIntegerNumbersFormat value)
      Sets the coding of integer numbers in binary data Swapped means the endianness of the instrument is different from endianness of the Control PC.

    • writeData

      public void writeData​(String command, byte[] binaryData) throws IOException, RsInstrException
      Writes all the data as binary data to the instrument It sends the entered command, followed by the constructed binary data header and the binary data from the binaryData.
      Throws:
      IOException
      RsInstrException

    • writeData

      public void writeData​(String command, InputStream stream) throws RsInstrException
      Writes all the stream data as binary to the instrument It sends the entered command, followed by the constructed binary data header and the binary data from the stream.
      Throws:
      RsInstrException

    • queryData

      public void queryData​(String query, OutputStream stream) throws IOException, RsInstrException
      Queries binary data from the instrument and returns it to the provided stream
      Throws:
      IOException
      RsInstrException

    • queryData

      public byte[] queryData​(String query) throws RsInstrException
      Queries binary data from the instrument and returns it as byte array
      Throws:
      RsInstrException

    • queryDataWithOpc

      public byte[] queryDataWithOpc​(String query, Integer timeoutMs) throws RsInstrException
      Query binary data with OPC synchronization. Also performs error checking if the property QueryInstrumentStatus is set to true. If you set the timeout to null, the method uses the current OPC timeout.
      Throws:
      RsInstrException

    • queryDataWithOpc

      public byte[] queryDataWithOpc​(String query) throws RsInstrException
      Query binary data with OPC synchronization. Also performs error checking if the property QueryInstrumentStatus is set to true. The method uses the current OPC timeout.
      Throws:
      RsInstrException

    • queryDataWithOpc

      public void queryDataWithOpc​(String query, OutputStream stream, Integer timeoutMs) throws IOException, RsInstrException
      Query binary data with OPC synchronization, and returns it in the entered Stream. Also performs error checking if the property QueryInstrumentStatus is set to true If you set the timeout to null, the method uses the current OPC timeout.
      Throws:
      IOException
      RsInstrException

    • queryDataWithOpc

      public void queryDataWithOpc​(String query, OutputStream stream) throws IOException, RsInstrException
      Query binary data with OPC synchronization, and returns it in the entered Stream. Also performs error checking if the property QueryInstrumentStatus is set to true The method uses the current OPC timeout.
      Throws:
      IOException
      RsInstrException

    • queryBinOrAsciiFloatArray

      public double[] queryBinOrAsciiFloatArray​(String query) throws RsInstrException
      Queries an array of floating-point numbers that can be returned as ASCII format or in binary format. The array is always returned as the most-universal double array. - For ASCII format, the array numbers are decoded as comma-separated values. - For Binary Format, the numbers are decoded based on the property BinaryFloatNumbersFormat, usually float 32-bit (FORM REAL,32).
      Throws:
      RsInstrException

    • queryBinOrAsciiFloatArrayWithOpc

      public double[] queryBinOrAsciiFloatArrayWithOpc​(String query, Integer timeoutMs) throws RsInstrException
      Queries an array of floating-point numbers with OPC sync. The numbers can be returned as ASCII or binary format. The array is returned as double array. If you set the timeout to null, the method uses the current OPC timeout. - For ASCII format, the array numbers are decoded as comma-separated values. - For Binary Format, the numbers are decoded based on the property BinaryFloatNumbersFormat, usually float 32-bit (FORM REAL,32).
      Throws:
      RsInstrException

    • queryBinOrAsciiFloatArrayWithOpc

      public double[] queryBinOrAsciiFloatArrayWithOpc​(String query) throws RsInstrException
      Queries an array of floating-point numbers with OPC sync. The numbers can be returned as ASCII or binary format. The array is returned as double array. The method uses the current OPC timeout. - For ASCII format, the array numbers are decoded as comma-separated values. - For Binary Format, the numbers are decoded based on the property BinaryFloatNumbersFormat, usually float 32-bit (FORM REAL,32).
      Throws:
      RsInstrException

    • queryBinOrAsciiSingleFloatArray

      public float[] queryBinOrAsciiSingleFloatArray​(String query) throws RsInstrException
      Queries an array of floating-point numbers that can be returned as ASCII or binary format. The array is always returned as single array. If the BinaryFloatNumbersFormat is Double8Bytes or Double8BytesSwapped, the method an Exception. - For ASCII format, the array numbers are decoded as comma-separated values. - For Binary Format, the numbers are decoded based on the property BinaryFloatNumbersFormat, usually float 32-bit (FORM REAL,32).
      Throws:
      RsInstrException

    • queryBinOrAsciiSingleFloatArrayWithOpc

      public float[] queryBinOrAsciiSingleFloatArrayWithOpc​(String query, Integer timeoutMs) throws RsInstrException
      Queries an array of single floating-point numbers with OPC sync. The numbers can be returned as ASCII or binary format. The array is always returned as single float array. If the BinaryFloatNumbersFormat is Double8Bytes or Double8BytesSwapped, the method throws an Exception. If you set the timeout to null, the method uses the current OPC timeout. - For ASCII format, the array numbers are decoded as comma-separated values. - For Binary Format, the numbers are decoded based on the property BinaryFloatNumbersFormat, usually float 32-bit (FORM REAL,32).
      Throws:
      RsInstrException

    • queryBinOrAsciiSingleFloatArrayWithOpc

      public float[] queryBinOrAsciiSingleFloatArrayWithOpc​(String query) throws RsInstrException
      Queries an array of single floating-point numbers with OPC sync. The numbers can be returned as ASCII or binary format. The array is always returned as single float array. If the BinaryFloatNumbersFormat is Double8Bytes or Double8BytesSwapped, the method throws an Exception. The method uses the current OPC timeout. - For ASCII format, the array numbers are decoded as comma-separated values. - For Binary Format, the numbers are decoded based on the property BinaryFloatNumbersFormat, usually float 32-bit (FORM REAL,32).
      Throws:
      RsInstrException

    • queryBinOrAsciiIntegerArray

      public int[] queryBinOrAsciiIntegerArray​(String query) throws RsInstrException
      Queries an array of integer numbers. The numbers can be returned as ASCII or binary format. The array is always returned as the most-universal int32 array. - For ASCII format, the array numbers are decoded as comma-separated values. - For Binary Format, the numbers are decoded based on the property BinaryIntegerNumbersFormat, usually int 32-bit (FORM INT,32).
      Throws:
      RsInstrException

    • queryBinOrAsciiIntegerArrayWithOpc

      public int[] queryBinOrAsciiIntegerArrayWithOpc​(String query, Integer timeoutMs) throws RsInstrException
      Queries an array of integer numbers with OPC synchronization. The numbers can be returned as ASCII or binary format. The array is always returned as the most-universal int32 array. If you set the timeout to null, the method uses the current OPC timeout. - For ASCII format, the array numbers are decoded as comma-separated values. - For Binary Format, the numbers are decoded based on the property BinaryIntegerNumbersFormat, usually int 32-bit (FORM INT,32).
      Throws:
      RsInstrException

    • queryBinOrAsciiIntegerArrayWithOpc

      public int[] queryBinOrAsciiIntegerArrayWithOpc​(String query) throws RsInstrException
      Queries an array of integer numbers with OPC synchronization. The numbers can be returned as ASCII or binary format. The array is always returned as the most-universal int32 array. The method uses the current OPC timeout. - For ASCII format, the array numbers are decoded as comma-separated values. - For Binary Format, the numbers are decoded based on the property BinaryIntegerNumbersFormat, usually int 32-bit (FORM INT,32).
      Throws:
      RsInstrException
